intro: Sonchus schweinfurthii, commonly known as the African dandelion, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with hairy stems and serrated leaves. Its bright yellow flower heads consist of numerous small florets, and it produces seeds that are dispersed by wind. Sonchus schweinfurthii is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in a variety of habitats.
